alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:40PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT ORANGE COUNTY THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 739 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Orange County. The strongest of these thunderstorms was near Florida, or 7 miles south of Middletown, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Florida around 750 PM EDT. Middletown and Howells around 800 PM EDT. Goshen around 805 PM EDT. Walden and Montgomery around 830 PM EDT. Other locations that could be impacted include Circleville, Pine Island, Bullville, Washingtonville, Scotchtown, Slate Hill, Maybrook, Pine Bush, Mechanicstown and New Hampton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
